metadata.title: CVE-2021-3575 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 18.04 LTS (bionic) - low
metadata.description:
A heap-based buffer overflow was found in openjpeg in color.c:379:42 insycc420_to_rgb when decompressing a crafted .j2k file. An attacker coulduse this to execute arbitrary code with the permissions of the applicationcompiled against openjpeg.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-3575` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libopenjp2-7 - 2.3.0-2+deb10u2ubuntu0.1~esm3
libopenjp2-tools - 2.3.0-2+deb10u2ubuntu0.1~esm3
libopenjp3d-tools - 2.3.0-2+deb10u2ubuntu0.1~esm3
libopenjp3d7 - 2.3.0-2+deb10u2ubuntu0.1~esm3
libopenjpip-dec-server - 2.3.0-2+deb10u2ubuntu0.1~esm3
libopenjpip-server - 2.3.0-2+deb10u2ubuntu0.1~esm3
libopenjpip-viewer - 2.3.0-2+deb10u2ubuntu0.1~esm3
libopenjpip7 - 2.3.0-2+deb10u2ubuntu0.1~esm3
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: openjpeg2 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.3.0-2+deb10u2ubuntu0.1~esm3').
insighttoolkit4 package in bionic is affected and may need fixing.
